title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions:
I sent in my application, cover letter, and resume in January, and hadn't heard back for a few weeks. I followed up with the Admissions Department, but never heard back from my follow-up email. A few months later, I was asked for a Zoom interview and I accepted.

The interview went well. They had 3-4 people on the call asking questions and everyone was welcoming and kind. 

They called me in for an in-person interview after that, which they said would last for 2 hours if I am remembering correctly. When I came in to interview, they had the team interview me in a conference room, which went well. I then had a tour of the campus and had two more interviews-- one with staff from other departments, and one with a higher up in Admissions.

This is when things got a bit odd. While I was in the third interview with the higher up, she went on her phone and started texting during the interview even though she also said there was no emergency. I thought this was odd, but then the interview time went over by an hour. I felt as though this was not respectful of my time. She had also called in an employee who had asked for paid time off that day (and he had been accepted for that PTO), and she told him she wanted him to be in the office that day in order to help interview me. This showed me that the Admissions Department didn't seem to have a culture of having work-life balance and healthy boundaries. I felt bad that this employee had to come into work after he had already been approved to have the day off. 

I was still interested in the position at this point though, so I was looking forward to hearing back from them after the in-person interviews. The higher up said she would let me know their decision by Wednesday of the next week. When the next week came around, I never received any email or form of communication from the school. (Even if they needed more time to decide, I think it would have been conscientious and respectful to communicate that on the Wednesday that I was looking to hear back from them). 

By Tuesday of the following week (so nearly a week late), they emailed me and asked for another interview where I would be asked to do a 20 minute presentation. I love presentations and didn't mind this particular request, but I found it disrespectful that they were a week late in communicating when they easily could have said they were going to get back to me a little later, and they were asking for another interview when they had let on to giving me a decision on my employment during this time. I decided to decline their additional interview offer, but I believe I did so kindly. They never responded to my email.

Overall, I felt as though my time had been sorely wasted, and I was not happy with this process and the lack of clear communication.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you keep track of multiple projects at the same time.

title: Curatorial Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: IU HR should establish better campus-wide standards and accountability for hiring managers. I interviewed for a position at the museum over Zoom and in-person. Everyone I met was pleasant and the questions/ issues raised were solid. However, there were many problems with organization and communication during the search: silence and weeks-long delay in scheduling after being asked for a campus visit, to the point I thought I had been ghosted; poorly organized and last-minute travel plans; numerous staff members did not show up for the scheduled interviews or were late; I wasn’t told I needed to do a presentation until I was already in the interview and thus hadn’t reviewed the ppt and didn’t have my notes; I could go on. And then after all this effort, time off from work, and significant travel during covid, I received an automated, impersonal rejection from HR. Considering the small size of the field, this behavior is not just rude but also short-sighted. If this experience reflects how hiring is being handled campus-wide in the current job market, it’s no wonder the university is having staffing issues.
Interview Questions: How would you improve communication?

Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. Interviewers were extremely knowledgable.  The position is solely for IU students and you can tell through the interview that this is a great way to grow professionally. The interview took about an hour and I was interviewed by two people.
Interview Questions: How do you think you can grow from this position?

title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Lead language program, organize social events, connect international and domestic students, communicate across departments and student organizations, send emails and work with sponsors, maintain a good relationship with the student leaders
Interview Questions: How did you manage your schedule with a part-time job and school work

title: RPS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I got a phone interview over the summer and asked various of questions on leadership and how I work alone and as a team. They asked questions on school life and also how well I can balance it since it was during University.
Interview Questions: "How well do you work in a team setting"

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone call where I learned more about the position.  I was invited to a 1:1 interview with the supervisor and then an interview with the rest of the staff in smaller group meetings where I learned more about the position how it fit with the department and what the expectations were.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had something happen that was unexpected and how did you handle the situation?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview with the hiring committee that lasted 15-20 mins. A second phone interview with the Director that lasted 15-20 mins. A final on-campus interview with the committee that lasted 45 mins. After the final interview, the Director asked me to send my reference info. The process was 3 months from application to job offer... with the longest amount of time being from the in-person interview to the formal offer (1 month)
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Administrative Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: Human Resource manager phone interview. Second interview in person with department manager. Final interview with potential coworkers and department manager.  The application process to the job interview was weeks so be patient after applying.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: I already lived in town, so it was easy to navigate my way around. The interview was very informal, and about 30 minutes long. They asked questions about my CV.
Interview Questions: They asked about my research.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Nashville, TN) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I walked into the office, I went to the AA, I stated my name and I waited for the interview to commence.  I then talked to the interviewer and told them my specifics
Interview Questions: Why I was thinking about leaving my current position.

title: Graduate Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was amazing, the culture and feel of the university was very warm and inviting. I enjoyed connecting with the interviewer and learning more about each other casually before even diving into the position. In addition the questions asked were more scenario and experienced based.
Interview Questions: What's a program or initiative that you would like to implement at Indiana University?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: It was quite a process. First I applied online and then they called me for a phone interview then I had to do a few in office interviews overall it took over three weeks to complete the entire process
Interview Questions: Why IU

title: User Experience Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: It was one-time interview process with their Director, Web developer, Data Analysist.  Had me seating in their conference room and displayed my portfolio on the screen. Asked me to present any work that I would like to/
Interview Questions: Had a in-person interview with their Director, Web developer and Data analysist. They mainly asked more about your own experience with design in details, had me present my portfolio, asked which parts I contributed to, what kinds of software I used. Do I wrote HTML/CSS, do i had experience working with web developer, do I know agile enviroment? Mostly I felt their web developer was looking for UX designer who works well with him either personality or skills. He asked me one question that caught me off guard "What is your favorite font?" Other than that, everything's fine.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of a common Application with Individual essay that gave a few different prompts and asked that you pick one of them and write a no more than 5 pages
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Indiana University

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Tell prof about passion. You may need to grade if below 95. Pretty chill interview however. Email professor prior to make sure he or she knows you to make interview less strange.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Went through a knowledge/question test regarding user systems and general IT help. Was asked questions about how to go about how to fix certain situations on certain operating systems and contexts.
Interview Questions: How do you force quit a program in Mac OSX?

title: Assistant Director, Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly typical compared to others. The interviewer was friendly. Many of the questions centered around my experience relevant to the position and interest in the organization. Overall, it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Talked with professor about life in the group as well as with the grad students that were currently in the group. More of a conversation than an interview as I was already admitted to grad program.
Interview Questions: Math skills? CS skills?

title: HPDC Mechanical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Houston, TX) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very hard had 2 interview loved everything about it ! to set it as visible to employers so that employers can review your work experience, skills and goals. We'll tell you how many profile views you get each week going forward. You never know what's o
Interview Questions: Easy but I loved it thank you

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: was perfect and the Pharmacist was very friendly and smiling. we started with the medical background and after that we talked about my experience. after that I went in a tour to see all the departments.
Interview Questions: what is your experience ?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview for this job. You just have to go in to whichever location you are looking to work at and give them your class schedule. If they have opening that fit your schedule you will most likely be hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two people interviewing and taking notes from you. Firstly, they asked normal questions to get to know you such as why you are interested in this position and how this position can contribute to your career.  Then we did a translation test on paper (if you apply for special language assistant).
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this position?

title: Academic Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: It is a short interview asking fundamental accounting questions. The interviewers are from academic advising team and they will let you explain a accounting question. The interview process is smooth and relaxing.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply for this position

title: Mailroom/Marketplace Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two people interviewed me for this part-time job. It was pretty easy they just wanted to get to know me as a person. They also wanted to know my work ethic and if I was available to help out in the office in addition to the regular job.
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me about yourself please?

title: Card Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: In-depth, yet efficient. I spoke to two different people during this process. The wait time to hear back was less than a week, though the training took multiple weeks.
Interview Questions: How would you keep yourself busy during down-time

title: Lab MA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Extremely casual and laid back. By the time you actually get an in person interview you are likely 1 of only a handle full of potential candidates. IU HR loves to drag out the process and there is almost no clear communication about the position until HR approves you and they hiring manager can send you an offer letter. The offer typically stands and they are not likely going to budge on your salary. Maybe if you have a lot of experience you can negotiate more.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have that will add value to our lab?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to IU for graduate recruitment weekend and interviewed with numerous professors in the department. I was later admitted to the program and once I arrived at IU I could speak with the professors and decide which lab I wanted to rotate in and then join.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your own research.

title: Emergency Management Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got a request for a phone interview about a month and a half after applying. The phone interview was pretty routine, just went over my resume and the position. I had to complete a five question assessment afterwards which was not too complicated. About two weeks later, I had a video interview with the hiring manager and two others. This interview hardly asked questions relevant to the position and was more personality based. I was ultimately denied the position about a month later. All interviewers were nice, however the process was way too long.
Interview Questions: If you found out the boss was lying to his wife, would you tell her?

title: Systems Analyst/Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Same as anywhere else. Basic questions that anywhere else asks you plus a small skills test.  The skills test was easier than expected but there was no actual technical interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a SQL database setup.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I went to apply for the job and filled out a job application. The manager received my application the same day and I was able to get the job within 48 hours
Interview Questions: What was my schedule like?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Spoke briefly with the director of the department; submitted qualifications and was hired based upon merit. The interview process was very simple and straightforward, with nothing to stress about. There is nothing more of note to say.
Interview Questions: what mathematics classes have you taken?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for Software Developer position in online, got contacted and had two phone interviews. Interview is not hard, basically they focused previous projects. I have answers almost all the questions, since I am international they don't wont hire.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Had phone interview and two face to face. One interview in Indianapolis and one interview in Bloomington Indiana..this was a reposted job. I had not applied the first time it was posted.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: you have to be referred by either someone else working in the office or you can ask the administration if there are job openings in either the fall or spring.
Interview Questions: how do you manage your time

title: Project Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process lasted within a 2 month span. I applied, and then I had one in-person interview which lasted 30 minutes. I got a call back two months later and got offered the job.
Interview Questions: Questions regarding working independently, navigating administration and university politics.

title: Media Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Really laid back! Nice and genuine. I enjoyed talking to their staff and learning more about their work. Grade A work place. Friendly and positive people. Loved the environment. And Bloomington is great.
Interview Questions: How would you handle ethical situations?

title: New Student Orientation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty relaxed. First round was a group interview where they see how you interacted with one another and had different events such as public speaking, Q&A sessions, etc. The second round was a interview with two other people. It was pretty basic and just asked behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Describe to me a time when you faced an obstacle and how you overcame it.

title: Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Telephone Round- Personality + Technical
In Person with Management (group panel)-Personality
In Person with Senior Management-Personality
Telephone round - they asked me about my projects,told me about work they do
Group Panel Interviews- Gauged where my skills would fit their environment and where they feel it would be necessary for me to learn new things and told me the same promptly
Interview Questions:
About all the projects.
They generally look for that the person is keen on learning new technologies and is enthusiastic in experimenting with the technology at hand.Interview team is extremely welcoming and warm.
They are all scholars from various fields but don't expect they would not know anything from your field.I loved meeting with the team and I greatly appreciate their promptness with the process.I will love to be a part of this institute as they are working towards getting a cure for Alzheimer's and it gives me great pleasure to know that I will be associated with something that helps reduce human suffering.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to describe the various projects I had worked on as per my resume. Then a bunch of questions followed around the topics of my previous work experience.
Interview Questions: What kind of tools/techniques could be used for log analytics?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hardly existent, they were so desperate for bodies to fill the kitchens that when I applied, I received an email telling me that I was hired the next day. I was also given little to no training.
Interview Questions: There were no questions asked

title: Undergraduate Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty easy you just go to class and make sure you get an A. Then you fill out the application and get selected for the teaching position. It is pretty straight forward
Interview Questions: Why do you you want to teach this class?

title: Food Court Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Asked what are my qualities and why I am good for this job, spoke a little about me and the interviewer also spoke about herself. It was an effortless conversation. She judged what positions I would be best for based on my qualities.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you possess which are useful for this job?

title: Assistant Research Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included the majority of the physicians that I would be working with as well as a lunch with a minority of them. The Chair and I met first.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a very smooth and easy process of just one day panel interview. I submitted paper application and got call for interview same day. And Associate director and head manger took my interview.
Interview Questions:
Describe yourself?
How will you mange school life and office work?

title: Tech Team Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy only asked about customer handling experience. The upper admin is good and they try to make you comfortable with a small conversation. Interview is really easy and crackable.
Interview Questions: Do you have any customer handling experience.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process to get accepted into the program. Just the usual application package. There are graduate recruitment weekends, but usually it's the graduate students that have already been accepted into the program come to the school to visit faculty to decide who to work for. So it's almost as if the tables are turned.
Interview Questions: What are your research interests? What is your experience?

title: Visiting Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the visiting lecturer position. I received a call to come in for an interview with the Department Chair. We talked about my previous teaching experiences, I met the other faculty in the department, we discussed the program and classes I would be teaching for the upcoming semester. I received an offer that day.
Interview Questions: I wasn't asked any difficult or unexpected questions for the interview.

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: asked lots of behavior questions as it's a customer-based job. They gave some scenarios of customer asking you questions and ask me to respond. They also asked some basic knowledge e.g. how many print quota for grad student and undergrad?
Interview Questions: how many print quota for grad student and undergrad?

title: AI Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: no real interview - you fill out some information about classes you feel capable of teaching and why you want to teach and you're off to the races.  I can't submit this with under 50 words, but really, that's it.  You can also apply through a professor that you've taken the class with & done well in.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Labor Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the labor managers and answer a few questions. They will sit you down and find out more about you.  They want to know what you are like, and to see if you are the kind of person that will put in the work necessary to do the job.
Interview Questions: Asking if you can work as a part of a team and if you have a good work ethic.

title: Biology PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Definitely contact the professor(s) you would like to work with well before you apply online. Ask them if they are taking students and discuss their future research interests to see if they align with yours. Ask about their mentoring style. It is very rare that people who do not contact professors ahead of time go on to the next round or get admitted. Graduate recruitment weekends fly prospectives out. There is a full day of interviews with professors of your choice, a dinner on the first day. The second day is activities of your choosing (to explore Bloomington) and a party the following day. In the interviews, they will ask about your past research experience and what you want to pursue in the future.
Interview Questions: What do you think your dissertation will focus on?

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward, no curve ball questions. Interviewers are pretty laid back, not hostile. Didn't last too long, got to the point. I got the position, so I was pretty happy with how to the process came along. The decision took a little while to come to, but no real issues.
Interview Questions: There is rush of customers at food concepts and cash registers, and packaged products are completely out of stock in the store front. How do you prioritize each task?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with the supervising professor of a molecular and biochemical laboratory followed by a "group" interview that consisted of shadowing for a day or two to assess group dynamic
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Computer Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about various computer hardware parts. Some basic software skills. Recognizing the hardware components of the personal computer. I was then asked about myself, what degree am I pursuing and how acquainted I am working with Personal Computers. I was asked if I was ready to help other people in IT related troubleshooting and travelling around campus to help with problems at various Library locations.
Interview Questions: Identify various hardware components of PC.

title: Associate Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Well, this is a grad student job, so there wasn't exactly an interview process. I mean, there was an application, which we all knew didn't mean anything because the professors were just going to pick who they wanted to work with anyway. And, like most departments, mine was underfunded and some people wouldn't get positions and would often have to drop out.
Interview Questions: Do you want a position doing teaching or research?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: It was very casual. I was contacted and asked a few questions about what I had taught in the past. I had to send in my resumé/CV and they reviewed it and let me know when I was back in the area to meet with the supervisor to go over plans for the class. I was already familiar with the university, so there were not a lot of formalities taken that may be taken with others.
Interview Questions: What times and days are you available?

title: Undergraduate Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a different position, but since it was filled, I was transferred over.I was not sure for a while where I would work but they assured me I would find a place.
Interview Questions: Questions about previous experience

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviwed for a technology center consultant position. I applied online and they got back to me for an interview. Then I was hired and had to go through one day of training
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Library Assessment Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got the email ID from a senior, found the employer, mailed my resume. We had a mail chat about the job and was asked to meet in person. Spoke about what I did got the job.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for?

title: Clinical Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: It's a university, so the process wasn't quick. I began applying in July and continued to apply through September. I got an email from a manager to schedule a phone interview, which ended with the manager asking to schedule an in person interview the following week. That interview was with two team managers, one of whom was the manager from the phone interview. I reached out a couple days later to follow up and was told they had submitted a request to hire. Two weeks later I got an email from HR and my soon-to-be manager with my official offer letter.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you, as part of a team, encountered a problem and describe what you contributed to overcoming that problem.

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and cover letter for the position and then was contacted after a few days about setting up an interview. The interview was pretty straightforward, it was only myself and the interviewer in the room. The interviewer read off a sheet of questions and wrote down my answers as we went along. Then a few days after that I was sent an email with an official offer for the position.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you worked as a team.
Tell me about a time you displayed leadership.
Tell me about a time you handled a crisis.

title: Computer Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had two or three phone interviews and went to the local office that was hiring to do a four hour in-person interview. Phone interviews consisted of technical questions and in-person interview consisted of technical and personal questions.
Interview Questions: write a function that takes in an int and returns a string   that would be how one would say that number (ex: 123 -> one hundred twenty three; 50019 -> five thousand nineteen)

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: It was a low stakes, meet and greet-type interview. They asked about my skills and experience related to the position and they discussed what the projects were coming up. Only needed to explain how skills/experience matched the position responsibilities. No hard questions. Was given the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. It takes several months to re-contact me again. The process is pretty straightforward. They gave me offer very soon after the presentation and group interview. The interview questions are not very hard. Such as, what is your strengths? What bring you here? Why are you interested in this position? Please introduce yourself? How to deal with team conflict? What is your career goal? What do you do after this temporary job?
Interview Questions: What is your strengths?

title: Facility Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview in an auditorium. It was also a written interview, writing down answers to questions on a sheet of paper. The hiring manager then called on various applicants to share their answer to different questions on the sheet. He tried to make sure he called on everyone to answer at least one question. Overall I liked this style of interview as I articulate myself well on paper so I think that even without any experience, being able to explain myself through writing helped me to get the job.
Interview Questions: How would you direct a participant to X location in the building?

title: Event Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with two managers, quick intro into the job, a few questions about how I would handle certain situations at a sporting event. Pretty simple and straight forward interview. Received an offer at the end.
Interview Questions: How would you approach a fan that appeared to need assistance?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: The time it took to review applications and schedule interviews was a bit slow, but that's normal for a university. I interviewed with a group of people, including my future direct supervisor. I was nervous, but everyone was friendly and made me feel at ease. I could tell they had prepared questions specific to me and my application instead of just using boilerplate questions for all candidates. I received a job offer about 2 to 3 weeks after my in-person interview and started my job about 2 to 3 weeks after that.
Interview Questions: They asked about work experience, education, strengths and weaknesses, team and individual work style, ideas for the new job should I get it, why I wanted the job, why I was the best candidate, and if I had any questions for them.

title: Student Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted via email within 1 week to schedule a 1:1 interview with the supervisor. 2 weeks from my application to the interview. Very straightforward and standard interview--no curve balls. 3 weeks in I was notified that I was not offered the position. This was the fastest processing time out of many applications I submitted.
Interview Questions: What types of people are difficult to work with?

title: Data Entry Part Time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone interview with one person in the department. Asked questions about previous experience related. Very much a general interview with basic qualification questions asked. It was a long distance interview, and they did a nice job of accommodating my time zone. It was an opening for multiple positions for part time work, so they wanted to make sure I could attend the necessary mass training.
Interview Questions: They specifically asked how one particular job I have previously held would help me in this job.

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty good interview with a pretty good guy, and they grilled me about my resume for about a half hour.  I got the job though.  It was no sweat.
Interview Questions: What are your best qualities?

title: Graphic Design Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a one-on-one interview based on a portfolio review. We sat in a small conference room across from each other. I provided her with a resume and showed her my protfolio. The process did not last more than an hour.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone interview. I had already been nearly accepted, I think they just wanted to gauge that I was a good fit and was excited about joining their department. All in all, I don't think the interview was a big part of the application process.
Interview Questions: What I was looking for in a graduate department.

title: Communications and Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, took some time to meet with committee, various other people after committee. There were several delays in the midst of the process after a delay in its start to begin with. I applied in November, had no contact until February. The process itself was not tremendously difficult, but it stretched a long time. This is not unusual for positions in a university, where the hoops for HR are unusually high, and I've experienced this quite a bit at IU.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Sitting in front of a Webcam explaining to the director of graduate studies why he should offer to have the school pay me $8050 pet semester. 
The director was generally laid back and easy to speak with. This was the least stressful portion of the experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be in Bloomington?

title: IU RPS Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They ask some basic questions about serving process and safety. Then they give some issues and want me to solve them as a supervisor. Nothing is too hard, just tell them what did you know if you really did a lot before.
Interview Questions: What if there are not enough students showing up?

title: Stagehand Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a fairly informal procedure, as it was for a low-level position backstage with many other things going on around the process. I spoke with management and discussed the responsibilities of the position, scheduling demands, and my background and skills relevant to the position. Everything was quite straightforward and to the point.
Interview Questions: Experience with construction-type work and tools.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to participate 3 short interviews a cross three days. I met people from different parts of the organization and they each asked similar questions. The people I met were friendly. The questions were basic and easy to answer. I learned a lot about the institution through the interviews. It was enjoyable.
Interview Questions: Tell us about relevant experience

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: was referred by an previous employee there. sent him email and made an appointment for the interview. it is a face to face interview with the supervisor professor after the holiday. nice professor and get me back few days later
Interview Questions: basic questions about your previous questions

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Dept head will choose the students depending upon the skills they have and will ask to give a simple test. 
Usually there is a online form which you will have to fill up and also can contact the professors if any subject is of interest.
Interview Questions: About Skills which you have and which will be helpful to teach

title: Senior Network Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions:
Process was quick. i was called for a phone interview and then in-person a week later. Given official offer next week.

Technical questions were pretty normal for my position. Team seemed interested in cultural fit. Entire team was present for in-person interview with some salary discussion in private.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Newsletter and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted three writing samples and a resume to apply for the position. The day after I applied I was contacted for an interview. We worked together to find a time that was convenient for both of us. I was interviewed by the previous intern and the HR Manager, both were very kind and made the experience pleasant.
Interview Questions: What do you know about our company?

title: Shaffer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: You apply through email. Notified for interview. Interview with the graduate student and/or professional staff member that you will be working under. They are very nice and make you feel comfortable. Seems to be a very fun office!
Interview Questions: Why should you receive this position? What do you hope to gain out of this experience?

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process, fairly quick - too three weeks - first interview with a panel of supervisors, then brought back to meet staff and higher level administrators. The questions were relevant and well thought out, no tricky games. I liked that they didn't waste time on silly questions, and seemed equally focused on educating me on job responsibilities. There was a section in the second round interview where the supervisor sat with me and showed me actual job duties.
Interview Questions: Nothing to speak of.

title: UITS Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was mostly about my past work experience and about my team management skills. They looked at my resume and asked me details about the technical skills I claimed. They explained the work they do and asked if this is something I would be interested in.
Interview Questions: How well do you think you can fit in a team

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: There was a telephone interview which is a non technical, about my previous job experience. Then video conference interview. Which is a technical. .After 3 Weeks they Said They Were Decided to Interview Additional Candidates to Determine the best candidate.
Interview Questions: Basic technical questions

title: Gerald L Bepko Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went in an interviewed with my internship supervisor. Very laid back interview. We mostly took a tour of the facilities and he explained what he was currently working on. I was interested in the topic beforehand, so it went by pretty smooth.
Interview Questions: Topics on XBee wireless modules.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The process is in 3 phases
Initial with a HR and some basic technical questions
Second phase will be a technical panel interview
Third will be a Programming interview on a case study
Interview Questions: Initial HR interview

title: Assistant Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Instructors send announcements to students who previously excelled in the relevant courses, offering positions as Undergraduate Instructors for the upcoming semester. On the course website, there was a link to apply to positions for several courses in the department. The questions were basic and mainly checked for personal comfort in teaching the subject. After about a week, I received an email from my instructor with details for the position, and then met with him once on the first day of class to introduce myself face-to-face, although it was not necessary.
Interview Questions: What was your final grade in the class you're applying to teach?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: You are interviewed by the professor that you want to work with. He will discuss his research interests and ask you about your previous research experiences and what type of work you want to do for Graduate school.
Interview Questions: There weren't any. Everything is very laid back, you just have show that you are interested about the professor's work.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: You need to apply online to submit your Personal Statement, Resume, transcripts, and everything you think that might be helpful for you application. Then you will be arranged an interview by several PIs and a student to record. After the interview, if you are admitted, you will be contacted.
Interview Questions: Most question concern deep technique.

title: IU RPS Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: As a student, I was able to easily get the job for this position. It was a simple matter of filling out the online application and waiting for the confirmation email. There was no real formal interview, and there was no negotiation on what I would be paid.
Interview Questions: I would suppose it was unexpected when they wanted to know my GPA on the online questions.

title: Student Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Talk with manger and assistant manager directly. You need to have some job experiences with students, welling to help, passion of work. You need to have experiences with every working station also you cannot have experience with unreason leave work.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your feel difficult to work ?

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
1. Started from Layer 1 and gradually moved onto Layer 4.
2. The interview panel first described about the position and what they're expecting.
3. The panel consisted of around 5-6 people and each asked questions one by one.
Interview Questions:
1. Questions on different types of fiber optics.
2. Questions on STP
3. Questions on BGP/OSPF
4. Questions on Ip addressing and subnetting

title: Janitorial Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: talk to President  and CEO fill out all paperwork and insurance. want to know if your a team player and if your a self starter. Take a short assesment test. wanted to make sure we had reliable transportation.
Interview Questions: if I was predjudice

title: Caterer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: Was hired by reference, interview was very casual and was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: I wouldn't say there was a difficult question, it's a very low paying job and they just want you to serve food.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: applied online, waited for 2 months for a phone interview, then an onsite interview
Interview Questions: normal questions, teaching/research exerpience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: I was hired based on existing relationship with the lab supervisor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online in November. Got an email to the recruitment weekend mid December. Offer you an invite to recruitment weekend for interviews during the end of February. Interview with a lot of different professors, mostly them telling you about their research.  Lasts an entire weekend, but it was very relaxed.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: the hiring process at Indiana university will be slightly different depending upon the nature of the job applied for. For me it was a phone interview followed by an on campus visit with a tour of the facilities. I received a formal offer shortly after the phone interview so the campus visit was largely for my benefit, but this is not the norm .
Interview Questions: The interview that I had was a very relaxed conversion about the work that I would be doing, so there weren't really any difficult questions.

title: Part-Time Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just talk to the people who is in charge, and he will give you the opportunity
Interview Questions: Your schedule

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basically you fill out an online form. The questions usually focus on what your interests are, what your skills are with programs like excel, or if you had any prior experience. your schedule is also taken into account as they cannot ask you to change your academic schedule for the job.
Interview Questions: None, if you have the skills or experience that they desire they offer the job.

title: Event Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with multiple people from the office that played different roles in the job that I (later) accepted. One was my direct supervisor, and the other was higher-up, although she did end up playing a huge role in my internship. The interview lasted about an hour, but it was an easy going conversation.
Interview Questions: What was the biggest challenge in your event career? How did you overcome it?

title: Human Resources Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Received a call from HR, short phone screen and then face-to-face interview with 7 people. After meeting with interview committee, had interview with hiring manager who made me feel comfortable and asked me about what I was looking for in a job.
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in this position?

What do you know about IU?

Asked to review my experience with them.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (New York, NY) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: No interview just submitted all required documents and recommendation letters. Strong recommendation letters are the most important. Check deadlines and keep in touch with graduate program director through out the process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Help Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward. No behavioral questions
Interview Questions: none that i can think of

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: It took quite a long time between when I submitted my application and when I was called back for an interview. The interview went well, but it was a long conference room and I was interviewed by 8 people at once. For an entry level position, I found this very surprising and intimidating. About a week after the interview, they checked my references and within a day I had an offer. While I was disappointed that they took so long initially, I was pleased with how speedy it went after the interview.
Interview Questions: They asked for an example in which I had dealt with disrespectful students.

title: Medical Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty chill environment. The PD asked me a few questions before we started talking about randoms things
Interview Questions: Not much was unexpected if you went prepared. They'll definitely try to get a feel of where you are with ranking their programs, but just try to relax and be honest, and you should do fine.

title: Hourly Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: A friend helped me touch base with my current boss, and we ended up meeting for an interview. We figured out what hours I could work, and then I was told that I got the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have any networking experience?

title: Clerk/Support Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Indiana University (Gary, IN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Department Manager. This was a student position for the college. She described the tasks, guidelines, and shared in the office environment. She provided me my paperwork, office policies and procedures and started me the next day. Experience was not necessary but I was expected to know how to use manners on the telephone, how to do data entry, and how to work Microsoft Products.
Interview Questions: How are your typing skills?  Do you know how to use Word and Excel? Have you ever done switchboard and why kind? When are you available so we can fit into your schedule?  As a student your education is priority here, so it is up to you to let us know if we need to adjust your schedule, you can to that can't you?

title: Staff Photographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and then was asked to come in for an interview. Was asked about former education and photography experience. Discussed newsroom values and ethics. Employer expressed an interest in the possible staffer being able to work with a variety of speakers and invited guests in a professional manner.
Interview Questions: What is your previous newsroom experience?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Process began with initial contact at welcome week job fair. From their they led me to a try out consisting of a 500 yard swim and basic lifeguard saves/CPR challenges. Depending on your score at the tryout you were invited to a group interview with two hiring staff members. If you performed well here you were offered a position.
Interview Questions: What do you do to keep your mind from straying away while guarding?

title: Residence Hall Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: First, a job fair is host for anyone about once a month. People can know the employer, their daily responsibility and hiring positions. Then managers of each departments will introduce themself, and then reiterate the positions needed new staff. After the job fair, people submit the application form. They can also have an opportunity to talk to the manager, or just waiting for further information through emails.
Interview Questions: Do you like travel? Where is your favorite place and describe it

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Initial communications began after submitting my application, resume and cover letter through the university's job website. About a day later I received an email from the manager of the group I was applying for who was interested in scheduling an 1:1 interview for sometime in the coming days. I quickly replied and received a message back within minutes that included a time and meeting place for the interview as well as suggestions for parking, as public parking is very limited on the campus.

The interview itself was brief, about 20 minutes total. It was a fairly straightforward interview. No odd or unreasonably difficult questions were asked. Basically, all questions were about relevant work experiences as well as educational background. Also asked were my goals for  the future, specifically regarding long term employment with the university.
Interview Questions:
What are your goals for the future with regard to long term employment with the university? Is that something you would be interested in?

Follow up question:
What would your dream position be with the university?

title: RPS Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, for the next semester and received an email almost instantly saying I got that job! No interview, just show up to orientation in the summer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was essentially nonexistent, was asked to send over qualifications via e-mail in the form a CV and was sent an offer for the job a week later. I would highly recommend this job to anyone who is looking for a relatively easy and straight-forward interview process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Media Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: They loved what I submitted. Great interview process.
Interview Questions: Can you write more efficiently?

title: Web Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview. With Technical Review. Final interview with CIO
Interview Questions: Social questions and experience in Academia

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University
Interview Descriptions: Received phone call several days after submitting resume. Then scheduled an on site interview. Not a formal interview. Just talked with all the team members. No presentation needed.
Interview Questions: Didn't ask any difficult or unexpected questions.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The overall process takes about a whole academic year starting with a information session in the fall followed by an application and then a 8 week class and finally an interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to deal with conflict.

title: Tech Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: clean computers, work with Photoshop, install printers, work with printer plotters. Know micorosft office suite. Talk on chat system and be active on there. work on remote system in case people all for help regarding their commuter. you travel to different computer clusters with a radio and make sure that all computers are on, clean, and in working condition. if not you create a ticket.
Interview Questions: Tech questions like working with photoshop, office suite, and hardware.. how familiar are you with it?

title: Security Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was fairly standard; what you might find anywhere else you would be interviewed.  Me with several members of the team I'd be working with as well as the manager.  Interview included a bit of behavioral interviewing as well as skills/technical questions.  Nothing too hard, but nothing easy either.
Interview Questions: Explain everything that occurs between a client-side browser and the server - from the client through the network to the server - when making a connecting to a webpage.  (essentially explain 3 way handshake, ports/protocols, and transmission of data)

title: UITS | TCC Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I sent my first application online like every one else. Then, I looked up the location of their offices a week later and went in person to check on my application.  They liked my initiative and moved forward to an interview the very next week.  I must have passed the interview because they hired me and I spent over two years working there.
Interview Questions: What is a MAC address?

title: Manager Applications Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN)
Interview Descriptions: After posting my resume, I was contacted about 2 weeks later via email. I had two interviews with them. The first one was a phone interview about 30 minutes long. I spoke with the director. She was very pleasant and easy to talk with. Because of my diverse IT background, I got a second in-house interview with the director and 3 other employees. Most of the conversation was them describing the work environment and them asking me about my previous projects. The culture of the people was friendly and lighthearted. From the time of entering the office and until I left, I felt welcomed. It seemed liked a fun place to work. I sent thank you notes to the people who interviewed me. The odd thing is that I have not been contacted since then, 2 months later. I now IU moves slow, but it's odd not to at least get an email saying they are still continuing their search.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give some detail about various IT projects I have managed or worked on, and if I had problems, how did I handle them.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met with a hiring manager and was asked the standard interview questions. They also asked which area I was most interested in.  Overall, it was a easy standard interview.
Interview Questions: What was my background? Why did I want the internship? What did I hope to learn?

title: Athletic Tutpr Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. Show up, know why you want to tutor athletes and have examples of some people you have tutored previously.  If you have not tutored previously mention you have helped friends consistently with homework. Need 3.5+ to be considered
Interview Questions: Examples of when I tutored someone and why I did a good job

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: First, I had a brief phone interview that was also used to schedule my face-to-face interview.  The big interview was a two-part process:  one-on-one interview with Director and presentation with staff.  The one-on-one interview went well.  The presentation was a mock presentation that would be given to parents and students about the school.
Interview Questions: What do your experiences bring to the department?

title: Marketing/Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviews vary wildly. Some departments had 3 interviews before selection. Some had 1 to 7 people at the interview. Some had projects along with a portfolio required. Some took 6 months between steps of  application to contact for interview or second interview. Interviews lasted from 30 minutes to 4 hours. Some involved online proficency test as part of the interview.
Interview Questions: Questions asked by individuals not knowing the work required, therefore they couldn't properly ask valid questions or follow answers.

title: User Experience Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was somewhat haphazard and had a couple of unexpected delays due to inadequate staffing.  For a bit, I thought they were not interested in me as they were too busy with other things to remember to send me a confirmation that they wanted to hire me.  Fortunately I got back to them and it all worked out.
Interview Questions: These folks were not very difficult in the interview -- they just wanted to know what my skills were, etc.  No major challenges.

title: Hourly Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: You submit a cover letter and resume. They will call you to set up and interview. The interview takes a total of roughly 30 minutes. The questions asked are fairly easy if you've had any sort of food service experience. After the interview, I was called a week later about whether I got the position or not.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with management if you disagree on something?

title: Hourly Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied, got a call back to schedule an interview. My interview was with two of the associate directors. It was very informal. The questions were straight forward and easy to understand.
Interview Questions: What new concept would you like to incorporate?

title: Student Affairs Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with a friend, so he invited an inpartial 3rd party, which I appreciated.  I was asked in-person to interview, and was the only candidate.  I was talked at more than questioned during the interview, and found this helpful.  I was asked questions by the 3rd party to ensure a lack of bias.
Interview Questions: How do you deal/handle bureaucracy?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to do a "job" talk and then I was interviewed one on one and in groups.The applicant talks to professors in every area of the business school.
Interview Questions: What is your scholarship area and why?

title: Athletic Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very little asked during my interview given that I was recommended for the job by the head of Academic Affairs in the Athletics department. Very friendly and courteous throughout the interview. Got back to me in less than a week.
Interview Questions: Q: Have you tutored before? If so, in what capacity?

title: Tech Team Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Indiana University (Indianapolis, IN) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring process is internal and you most be a current regular consultant to be brought aboard for an interview. On average at least 2 people will interview you and it lasts around 45/hour.

Questions on generally about troubleshooting and situations where you needed to assist someone. Part of the interview is hands on and revolves walking the panel through solving an issue with a testing laptop
Interview Questions: Know how to troubleshoot Windows/Mac systems as the hands-on part of the interview will test this.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Indiana University (Bloomington, IN) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions:
On an average it takes about 2 months from the time you apply for the job till you get a response. I had applied for at least 8 positions, out of 8, 2 were cancelled and nothing happened. Other 2 jobs were cancelled after they took my phone screen, & I was never informed about that. 1 job I wasn't short-listed. In all for 3 jobs I was interviewed.

1 of them I was never informed about the results, even after repeated querying. At this interview apart from technical interviews, I was asked about my Visa status, and when I told that I would need a sponsorship after 2 years, the interviewer told me to marry an American citizen, and get a green card, apparently making fun of me. I considered it disrespectful. I won't suggest that place for immigrants.

One of them did the something similar, and I was told that people of my ethnicity usually leave the job for higher pay. And was asked would you do the same. I think that was the criteria for them to hire.

At the third place, I was initially told that I was among the 3 finalists, and they chose some other candidate, because he his work experience in educational institute, and I didn't had. I made them realize that all my technical experience was in educational institutes; I was told that the chosen candidate had 15 years of experience. Though the job was advertised as entry level.

In all I would say Indiana University is not a good place to work.
Interview Questions: What is you Visa status?

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Indiana University in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was the easiest process to go through for me. I emailed one of the managers, and we set up a time for a group interview. I arrived a bit late (my class went long), but I walked into one of the event rooms where a group of maybe five or six others were sitting on some couches. It was a very laid-back atmosphere. Obviously, a lot of the interviewees were students.
